creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
text:
A restore from the archive or trash does not work. The document is pulled out of
the archive/trash and it does show up in the proper location under the authoring
tree, so the sitetree is updated. However, when restoring or navigating to the
document the following error is displayed:

The area [default:authoring] doesn't contain the document
[29f3b9b0-b081-11db-a538-a3c24189b6e1:en].

Looking on the file system, the archive/delete directory is cleared out from
having en or en.meta files, only bak's remain. However, the authoring directory
doesn't have en or en.meta files, only bak's as well.

Restoring from the trash or archive now leaves the document in a workflow state
of trash. From here it is impossible to do anything, including delete or archive.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org

text:
Yes, that's a strange phenomenon (see bug 41627). I'll try to find out what
causes it.
creator: andreas@apache.org

text: It should work now, see bug 41627. If not, please reopen.
creator: andreas@apache.org
